17/09/25, 8:28‚ÄØam - [PHONE]: *ITC Infotech - Qualified Students for Online Technical Test - Institute of Engineering & Management*

Please find the attached test platform guidelines.

Please find attached the list of students who have successfully qualified for the upcoming online technical test.
¬†
Test Details:
* Date: Thursday, 18th September 2025
* Mode: Online
* Time Slot : 9:30 to 10:45 am
¬†
Each qualifying student will receive a detailed email from [EMAIL] one day prior to the test date.
This email will contain important instructions along with the link to access the assessment platform.
¬†
Online Test Guidelines for students before starting the assessment!
¬†
Technical Setup
* Use a laptop or desktop only. The test will NOT run on mobiles or tablets.
* Recommended browsers: Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox (latest version).
* Clear browser cache before starting: Open the browser and press Ctrl + Shift + R.
* Ensure stable internet with a minimum speed of 512 kbps for optimal performance.
¬†
Room Setup
* Take the test in a quiet, well-lit, distraction-free environment.
* Sit in front of a plain wall with your face clearly visible.
    * If any individual/object appears in the background, or the environment doesn't meet the above conditions, you will bedisqualified to take the test.
¬†
Login & Test Access
* Your Test PIN is unique and can be used only once.
* If there is a power cut or internet drop, don‚Äôt worry. Just close the browser and log back inwith the same credentials to continue.
* Do NOT click anywhere outside the test window during the assessment.
¬†
Proctoring & AI Monitoring
* This is a camera-enabled, AI-proctored test. Your webcam must remain ON throughout.
* When prompted, click "Allow Access" to enable your webcam.
* The system will auto-disqualify you if:
    * You turn off, block, or disable your camera.
    * You are not clearly visible on screen.
    * Any other individual is visible in the background.
* AI will continuously monitor for any signs ofmalpractice or external help.
    * Any form of cheating will lead toimmediate disqualification.
¬†
Test Rules & Structure
* The test link will be valid only for the duration mentioned in your email.
* Start early to avoid last-minute challenges.
* The test contains multiple sections, each with a separate timer.
* No negative marking ‚Äî attempt every question.
¬†
Coding & Submission Guidelines
* Sample code is provided ‚Äî please delete it and write your own.
* Read the question carefully, including the problem statement, input/output format, etc.
* Ensure your output matches the exact format¬†mentioned in the problem statement.
* Use ‚ÄúRun‚Äù and ‚ÄúCustom Input‚Äù , any number of times, to test your code before submission.
* By clicking on Submit, your code will be auto-evaluated, and testcase-wise results will be displayed.
* You can submit each solution up to 5 times.
* Your last submitted version will be considered for scoring.
    * Failure to submit your solution will result in a Zero for that question.
¬†
Do‚Äôs & Don‚Äôts
Do‚Äôs:
* Close all background apps before starting (e.g., chat apps, browsers).
* Ensure your internet and camera are working.
Don‚Äôts:
* Do NOT switch tabs or navigate outside the test window.
* Do NOT use external tools/applications/devices.
* Do NOT take screenshots, photos, or record the test.
* Do NOT click ‚ÄúEnd Test‚Äù or close the window until you‚Äôve completed all sections.
‚Ä®Non-compliance will result in immediate disqualification.

Dear Students,

This is a gentle reminder for the mentioned students (list shared earlier) for the differential package evaluation process as per the below mentioned schedule:

*Date : 19th Feb 2026*
*Reporting time : 3:30pm*
*Reporting Venue : Buddha Auditorium, IEM Newtown campus.*

*_Note : The students will be getting the link only after physical attendance has been taken tomorrow._*

*Do's & Dont's:*

- Assessment Content: The assessment will be a single assessment combining Java, Python, SQL skills. You can expect approximately 20-30 questions for 150 minutes. The questions will be a mix of   multiple-choice questions (MCQs), coding, short descriptive, and scenario-based questions.

- Proficiency Levels: This assessment will be at basic level.

- In-Person Requirement: You need to be available in person at the venue. Once attendance is marked, the test link will be shared via email.

- Test Link: The test link will be shared via email from Coderpad. Copy the link and open it in the Chrome browser. The link has two assessment tabs: Tutorial and Test. The Tutorial tab has 2-3 questions and is not mandatory; it is just to give you a feel of the portal.

- Screen Recording: Once the assessment starts, the associate‚Äôs screen is recorded by the Coderpad tool. Any switching windows/tabs or copy-pasting code will be reported as unusual activity, so please refrain from such activities which will lead to strong disciplinary actions. Taking a print screen will end your test.

- Submitting Answers: You need to submit every answer and then go to the next question. Your previously submitted answer can be changed at any point, provided you submit the changes again. The submit button is on the right side below every question.

- Ending the Test: Once the timer is over, the test will be auto submitted. However, if you complete the test before time, you need to end the test by going to the home tab (top left of the assessment screen) and selecting the end test option (top right of the home tab).

- Call Requirement: Until the assessment is completed, you need to be in front of the invigilator once done, you can leave by informing the invigilator that you have completed and submitted the test.
